title: (x) Belgacom logo - custom designed by Landor {G (self)}
content:
Can anyone tell me wich type the [belgacom logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124727/http:/www.belgacom.be/home/gallery/design/logo_belgacom.gif) was done with? If I'd know the agency who did the belgacom housestyle I'd ask them, but I don't know that either.   
Thanks for any feedback   
G ![logo belgacom](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124727im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/34674.gif)
author: newnomad

comments.content: Looks like a cross between a modified [Pump](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124727/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/pump-2/pump-light/testdrive.html?s=belgacom&p=72) and [ITC Bauhaus](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124727/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-bauhaus/medium/testdrive.html?s=belgacom&p=72) - perhaps using alternate characters.

Usually whenever that style comes to mind, you could also look at one of the [House Chalet](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124727/http:/houseind.com/house.php?kit=CHALET-FO&sub=view) 'flavors' too. Looks like the 1960 & 1970 variations would provide these characters.

Thanks Yves.   
   
Its indeed custom designed with some of the flavours mentioned above.   
An acquaintance at [bubble](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124727/http:/www.bubble.be/) told me it was designed by [Landor](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124727/http:/www.landor.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=cNews.news&storyid=272&g=1200&n=1220&year=2002), from there I found [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124727/http:/users.ncrvnet.nl/mstol/belgacom.htm) excellent site on corporate identity by Hans Stol.   
   
I also found [Typ1451](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124727/http:/www.lineto.com/) from lineto as a 'stronger' alternative.   
   
Thanks all of you for the feedback,   
G
